Instead 'run' on only one leg by hopping forward on right foot. As traveling through air, pull right leg forward and bend left leg back while swinging left arm forward and right arm back. Right forefoot makes contact with floor. As entire foot lands on floor, pull left arm back and right arm forward. Continue hopping forward on right leg using same single-leg 'running' pattern until desired distance is reached. Repeat on other right foot."]
comments: Initial hop may or may not resemble Single-leg Hops with single concurrent bilateral arm motion. Land on forefoot then come down on whole foot.

preparation: Stand 17 to 18 strides from block. Run to block.
execution: ['Hop forward on first leg and land on same foot while keeping second foot elevated off of floor. Hop forward again on first foot and land on second foot. Jump forward on second foot. Bring both feet together with knees parallel to chest while jumping into the pit. Land jump with heels first.', 'Do not run beyond board during hop. While in air during hop, skip, and jump, throw arms in front of body, no lower than chest and no higher than chin height. See jump in slow motion.']
comments: Do not run beyond board during hop. While in air during hop, skip, and jump, throw arms in front of body, no lower than chest and no higher than chin height. See jump in slow motion.

preparation: Stand with one foot on box and other foot off, down by side of box.
execution: ['Jump sideways so opposite foot is on box and the other is off by side of box. Repeat shuffle side to side.']
comments: Upper body motion can be emphasized by throwing arms up during leaps. Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession.

preparation: Stand with one foot on box and other foot off, down by side of box.
execution: ['Jump sideways so opposite foot is on box and the other is off by side of box. Repeat shuffle side to side.']
comments: Upper body motion can be emphasized by throwing arms ups during leaps. See example. Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession.

preparation: Stand with feet close together. Bend knees and hips slightly with arms bent to sides or to front. Lift right foot up, slightly off of floor.
execution: ['Jump far to right side and land right foot with left foot off of ground. Jump far to left side landing on right foot. Continue to bound from side to side.']
comments: Attempt to progressively increase speed, length, height, or duration of jumps depending on training goal. Hip adductors are activated both dynamically (during bound) and isometrically (during landing on single leg). Also see Medicine Ball Lateral Bound.

preparation: Stand with feet together to one side of line on floor. Bend hips and knees sightly with arms to sides.
execution: ['Jump to opposite side of line and land on forefeet. Continue jumping from side to side landing on forefeet.']
comments: Hop side to side of line as quick as possible. Push off of forefeet with feet together.

preparation: Stand with both feet together in one of two lower sections of quadrant.
execution: ['Jump forward into upper quadrant then immediately jump diagonally back. Immediately jump forward to other upper quadrant, then diagonally back to starting square. Immediately repeat diagonally crossing pattern sequence.']
comments: Perform this exercise as fast as possible while avoiding stepping on lines and maintaining balance and control. Jump and land on forefeet with heels slightly elevated off of floor.

preparation: Stand with both feet together in one of two lower sections of quadrant.
execution: ['Jump to each square of quadrant in clockwise direction.']
comments: Perform this exercise as fast as possible while avoiding stepping on lines and maintaining balance and control. Jump and land on forefeet with heels slightly elevated off of floor.

preparation: Stand with both feet together to one side of extended line.
execution: ['Jump on both forefeetfeet in alternating diagonal pattern across each side of line. Continue jumping in zigzag pattern over line moving forward until marked distance is reached or for set time.']
comments: Suggested length of line is approximately 10-15 feet (3-4.5 m) long, but it can be any length. Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession. Also see exercise performed with Agility Ladder.

preparation: Place Agility Ladder on floor. Stand with your right foot in first box and with left foot outside box.
execution: ['Jump up with both feet to right and forward direction and land with left foot in box. Immediately push off both feet forward towards left direction to next box and land with right foot in box.']
comments: Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession. Movement can also be performed without Agility Ladder.

preparation: Stand with side to barrier.
execution: ['Jump sideways to opposite side of barrier. Upon landing, immediately jump to other side.']
comments: Use both upper and lower body movements. Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession.

preparation: Stand on box.
execution: ['Jump sideways down to side of box. Jump back onto box, then jump down to the other side of the box. Jump back onto the box and repeat.']
comments: Upper body motion can be emphasized by throwing arms ups during leaps. Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession.

preparation: Stand with cone to one side.
execution: ['Jump sideways to opposite side of cone. Upon landing, immediately jump to other side.', 'Use both upper and lower body movements. Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession.']
comments: Use both upper and lower body movements. Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession.

preparation: Stand with feet close together, holding medicine ball with hands on each side of ball. Bend knees and hips slightly with arms bent to sides or to front. Lift right foot up slightly off of floor.
execution: ['Jump far to right side. Land right foot with left foot off of ground. Position ball forward, away from body. Immediately jump far to left side, landing on right foot. Again, position ball forward away from body. Continue to bound from side to side in same fashion.']
comments: Ball can also be kept nearer chest without extending arm forward on each land, in which case, shoulder articulation becomes static. preparation: Straddle line on floor with arms to sides. Lift foot off of floor by bending knee. Slightly bend hip and knee of supporting leg.
execution: ['Jump to opposite side of line and land on forefoot. Continue to jump side to side landing on forefeet while keeping foot elevated.']
comments: Muscles which Abduct Hip and Laterally Flex Spine also server to stabilize these joints when jumping or standing on one leg.

preparation: Stand on one leg to one side of cone. Slightly bend hip and knee of supporting leg.
execution: ['Jump over cone to opposite side, landing on forefoot. Continue to jump over cone from side to side landing on forefeet while keeping foot elevated.']
comments: Muscles which Abduct Hip and Laterally Flex Spine also server to stabilize these joints when jumping or standing on one leg.

preparation: Straddle line on floor with arms to sides. Lift foot off of floor by bending knee. Slightly bend hip and knee of supporting leg.
execution: ['Jump on one foot in alternating diagonal (zigzag) pattern across each side of line. Jump and land on forefoot while keeping other foot elevated. Repeat with opposite foot.']
comments: Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Some individuals my exhibit spinal rotation during this drill, alternating from right to left swivels each jump.

preparation: Stand holding medicine ball with hands on each side of ball. Place feet wide apart, pointing approximately 45° outward and knees slightly bent. Bend over and place ball near outside of one foot.
execution: ['Raise ball up to side and up over head so torso is upright. Bend over to opposite side and lower ball down to outside of other foot. Repeat with opposite movement, alternating raising and lowering ball back and forth between sides.']
comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. See Spot Reduction Myth.

preparation: Stand holding medicine ball with hands on each side of ball. Place feet wide apart, pointing outward slightly. Raise ball above head with arms bent.

excercise_name: Medicine Ball Chest Throw Sit-up (on wall)
preparation: Sit on floor facing wall with knees bent. Hold medicine ball with both hands near chest.
execution: ['Lie back while hold ball near chest. Raise upper body up by first flexing spine and then flexing hips. While completing sit-up, throw ball toward wall. Catch ball bouncing off of wall with both hands. Reposition ball near chest while laying back. Repeat.']
comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Feet may also be secured under weighted or anchored structure. If feet are not being supported by fixed object, legs may need to be extended somewhat to offer adequate counter balance to upper body.

excercise_name: Medicine Ball Chest Throw Sit-up (with partner)
preparation: Two participants face each other and sit on floor facing each other with knees bent. Participants’ feet point toward one another. First participant holds medicine ball near chest with both hands.
execution: ['First participant lies back while holding ball. First participant raises upper body up by first flexing spine and then flexing hips. While completing sit-up, first participant throws ball to partner. Partner catches ball with both hands and executes same sequence. Participant and parter continue to exchange ball.']
comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Feet may also be secured under weighted or anchored structure. If feet are not being supported by fixed object, legs may need to be extended somewhat to offer adequate counter balance to upper body.

preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or narrower.
execution: ['Swinging both arms back to each side and squat down by bending knees and hips. Swing arms forward and jump upward. Immediately kick both legs forward while reaching forward so hands make contact with feet with legs straight. Extend body vertically, land on forefeet, and squat down to absorb impact. Pull arms back and repeat if needed.']
comments: Movement can be performed in successive repetitions (see Pike Jumps) or as single rep as shown.

preparation: Lie supine on floor with feet together. Partner stands with feet at each side of head. Grasp partner's legs, just above ankles to each side. Raise legs vertically so partner can bend over slightly to touch feet or ankles.
execution: ['Partner throws legs toward floor by pushing feet or ankles outward. Immediately lift straight legs back to vertical position by flexing hips. Partner continues to throw legs to floor by pushing feet or ankles away.']
comments: Continue to hold on to partners legs, just above ankles. Keep legs straight and avoid allowing heels to touch floor. Partner can bend knees in order to more easily bend over particularly if they are taller than participant. Partner can also push feet away to each side, alternating between forward and side leg raises and throws. Also see Lying Diagonal Leg Raise Throwdown.

excercise_name: Lying Diagonal Leg Raise Throwdown (with partner)
execution: ['Partner throws legs diagonally toward floor by pushing feet or ankles outward slightly to one side. Immediately lift straight legs back to vertical position by flexing hips. Partner continues to throw legs to floor by pushing feet or ankles away to one side.']
comments: Continue to hold on to partners legs, just above ankles. Keep legs straight and avoid allowing heels to touch floor. Partner can bend knees in order to more easily bend over particularly if they are taller than participant. Partner can also push feet away to each side, alternating between forward and side leg raises and throws. Also see Lying Leg Raise Throwdown without diagonal movement.

excercise_name: Medicine Ball Overhead Throw Sit-up (with partner)
preparation: Two participants face each other and sit on floor facing each other with knees bent. Participants’ feet point toward one another. First participant holds medicine ball with both hands.
execution: ['First participant lies back with ball over head and taps ball to floor. First participant immediately throws ball to partner from over head while sitting up. Partner catches ball slightly above and in front of head and repeats steps. Participant and parter continue to volley ball back and forth.']
comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Feet may also be secured under weighted or anchored structure. If feet are not being supported by fixed object, legs may need to be extended somewhat to offer adequate counter balance to upper body. If upper back does not come completely down at end of movement, abdominal muscles may only be isometrically involved in exercise. See Spot Reduction Myth. Also see Medicine Ball Sit-up on Machine.

preparation: Sit on floor facing wall with knees bent. Hold medicine ball with both hands.
execution: ['Lie back with ball over head and tap ball to floor. Immediately throw ball to wall from over head while sitting up. Ball rebounds off of wall. Catch ball slightly above and in front of head. Continue to volley ball against wall.']
comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Wall should be impact resistant to avoid structural damage. Feet may also be secured under weighted or anchored structure. If feet are not being supported by fixed object, legs may need to be extended somewhat to offer adequate counter balance to upper body.

preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or narrower. Swinging both arms back to each side and squat down by bending knees and hips.
execution: ['Swing arms forward and jump upward. Immediately kick both legs forward while reaching forward so hands make contact with feet with legs straight. Extend body vertically, land on forefeet, and squat down to absorb impact. Pull arms back to sides and repeat movement sequence for required number of repetitions.']
comments: Movement can be performed in successive repetitions as shown or as single rep (see Pike Jump).

preparation: Sit on bench. Position pole on back of shoulders. Place hands or wrists over each side of pole with arms extended.
execution: ['Rotate torso through waist to one side, then to the opposite side. Repeat.']
comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or time. See Spot Reduction Myth.

preparation: Stand holding medicine ball with hands on each side of ball. Place feet wide apart, pointing slightly outward. Bend knees slightly. Raise ball to side of head with arms bent.
execution: ['Bring ball downward diagonally around front of body to side of opposite hip by rotating torso and bending forward slightly while pulling ball across body. Immediately return to original position in opposite path by rotating and bring torso back upright while pulling ball to side of head. Repeat chops. Continue movement with ball held near opposite side of head.']
comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Besides using heavier ball, intensity may be increased somewhat by holding ball slightly further away from body. Since hips are slightly bent, technically some hip adduction / abduction occurs along with internal / external rotation. Knee extension could be considered either dynamic or static since only slight movement occurs under significant resistance.

excercise_name: Medicine Ball Squat and Overhead Throws
preparation: Stand with feet hip width apart. Hold medicine ball with both hands in front of upper chest or face.
execution: ['Squat down by bending knees and hips. Immediately squat up by extending hips, knees, and feet. Just before legs completely extend, begin to throw ball upward by extending arms upward. Repeat throwing and catching ball.']
comments: Squat and Overhead Throw is considered full body movement. Dynamic spinal extension may occur in some individuals performing maximal attempts. Slight spine flexion may occur during bent over squat position dependent upon participants depth and flexibility. Also, spinal hyper-extension may occur as body extends and leaves ground. Movement can also be performed intermittently for greater recovery between throws allowing for greater loads to be used (see Medicine Ball Squat and Overhead Throw).

comments: Typically, men throw at 10' (3 m) target, whereas, women throw at 9' (2.75 m) target.
